description: Actor Roman Madyanov, known for his roles in TV series and films, has been diagnosed with progressing lung cancer. The 61-year-old artist is undergoing anti-tumor treatment to combat the malignant neoplasm in the upper lobe of the bronchi and lung. Additionally, cysts were found in his kidneys, spleen, and liver. Madyanov is receiving treatment and observation to address his condition.
original:
The actor of the TV series “Soldiers” Roman Madyanov has progressing lung cancer. According to SHOT, the 61-year-old artist is undergoing anti-tumor treatment to prevent the development of the disease.

According to our data, Roman Sergeevich turned to doctors due to severe weakness. Doctors kept him in the hospital for one day, where he was examined and given antitumor drug therapy. The artist was diagnosed with a malignant neoplasm of the upper lobe of the bronchi and lung. Also, during the examination, doctors identified cysts that had formed in the kidneys, spleen and liver.

Roman Madyanov was discharged with observation at his place of residence and was prescribed another antitumor treatment, which will take place in April.

Roman Madyanov is a Soviet and Russian theater and film actor, Honored Artist of Russia, four times laureate of the Nika Award, laureate of the Golden Eagle Award for the films “12” and “Leviathan”. He became famous thanks to his roles in the TV series “Soldiers”, “Wapit Hunting”, “Chaliapin”, in the films “Super Beavers”, “At the Command of the Pike”, “Dream Team”. Subscribe to SHOTSend news
